Present location: BIBLIOTHECA ALEXANDRINA ANTIQUETIES MUSEUM [01/027] ALEXANDRIA BAAM
Name: Cylindrical Vessel of King Djoser
Description: The vessel has an elongated cylindrical shape with a turned rim. This vessel is one of thousands discovered under the pyramid of Djoser at Saqqara, in chambers called the blue chambers because it is lined with blue faience. The majority of these vessels are made of translucent, yellow alabaster, veined with white like this one. The others are made of different kinds of stones, such as the blue schist of Sinai, the diorite of Nubia, the granite of Aswan, the marble, the dolomite and the serpentine.Some of these vessels bear the name of predecessors of Djoser who reused it again. They were used to keep different kinds of food and drinks for the King to consume in the netherworld.
